website_summaries.verdict: Casual may be inculcated on its name, but wearing these sneakers exude luxury. The KEEN Austin Casual Slip-On sports an uncomplicated styling that fits a gentleman's everyday style.Its sizing maybe inaccurate and its new elastic system maybe deemed disapppointing but the shoe is still worth considering by any John Doe who’s always on the go. Versatile, easy-to-wear, well-crafted and comfortable, its pros clearly outweigh its cons.
pros: Many were quite pleased that the new version of the KEEN Austin Casual Slip-On retained the simple and straightforward style
One who owned several pairs of KEENs particularly liked these sneakers because its silhouette is not as chunky
A high number of consumers, including one suffering from Morton's neuroma, particularly liked the wide toe room that this lifestyle shoe possesses
One said that these are an excellent slip that can endure most seasons and weather
A large percentage of reviewers commended its footbed as it provides support and comfort all day and for long walks
An avid Merrell sneaker user found pleasure in wearing these sneakers because of its sturdy and quality materials
One user shared that he only planned on purchasing these for the winter but ended up liking it so much that it ended up as his daily shoe
Several KEEN enthusiasts found another reason to love the brand because of these sneakers
A couple of reviewers find that the soles and every component of the KEEN men's Austin Casual Slip-On are well-crafted
A small number of testers gave the cushioning system plus points
cons: Those who were able to experience the older version preferred it than these
The all-new elastic system injected on the shoe's features is not loved by a high number of consumers
Many complained about having a hard time slipping the foot in
A high percentage of users were disappointed with its sizing and dubbed the pairs as not symmetrical

customer_reviews.title: Different than other Keens
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair of Keens and only pair that was not perfectly symmetrical. the opening to the left shoe was visibly larger than the left, the right shoe elastic tighter. Looked like a one that should have been marked down due to this imperfection. Though shoes same size, the left one noticeably wider and loser when walking. Needed slip ons for travel, keeping them hoping the fit will evolve. All other Keens looked uniform and fit comfortably right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: California Girl

customer_reviews.title: which fits fine. Seem like really good shoes
customer_reviews.text: First pair waas 9.5, but it was way too tight. Then returned and got a 10, which fits fine. Seem like really good shoes. Not as clunky as some of the other style Keens I have had in past. I with they had a little less tread on the bottom, but that is just because I mostly walk on smooth surfaces. I can recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Runs smaller then Keens
customer_reviews.text: I am a Keen fan boy, 4 other pair in rotation right now. They look good, hold up well, and are great for wide feet. These were surprisingly inconsistent though. Way to narrow to even get on. I have the brown version of a similar slip on that fits great. I compared them after trying this and the toe box and sole were noticeably smaller. I sent them back for a refund the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Lycan66

customer_reviews.title: Built for Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these Keen Casuals for my spouse, who likes the protective toe design, & the everyday comfort that Keen shoes provide. She did cut out the elastics at the front, although that may be personal preference for her. When asked she told me they were comfortable. As a warehouse item they were in as new condition.
customer_reviews.author: John Bruell

customer_reviews.title: Nice wide toebox
customer_reviews.text: I like the larger toebox, has a similar fit to some of the other wider Kehn shoes. I actually polish the leather to a vibrant Cheyenne and use it as a dress shoe since most dress shoes have a very narrow toebox. I’ve actually had a few compliments on it
customer_reviews.author: jason h.

customer_reviews.title: These are my go to shoes now
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I wanted a pair of shoes to keep at my office, so I could change out of my boots in the winter. I thought a pair of slip on would be really convenient. I ended up liking them so much that they became my regular daily shoes. As I have gotten older I have needed shoes with a wider toe box, and all the keens I have purchased have worked really well for me. The only issue I have is if I wear thinner socks, they feel a little loose, but I think that is to be expected in a slip on shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D Karnopp

customer_reviews.title: keens
customer_reviews.text: I'm banquet chef work long hrs. I have been buying these shoes for 8 yrs I get about 2 year out of a pair my fitbit tells me a average about 6 to 10 miles a day times 2 years these shoes get a work out and my feet never hurt. Thank you keen for making a quality shoe I tell everyone there great
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Blackman

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe and well made
customer_reviews.text: as with most keen shoes I have owned which are many, the shoes are heavy materials and always a tad on the narrow side, but give them time and use to break-in. They will get more comfortable with use. They are built for the long-haul so far.
customer_reviews.author: UrbanTreeGuy

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable on the arch
customer_reviews.text: This could be a pretty nice shoe if it weren't so stiff and you could get your foot in it. Otherwise it's a waste of money. The manufacturer could've used a better leather for the price. Totally uncomfortable on the arch
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most Keens have the wide toe box, which makes a big difference. The Austin's do.
customer_reviews.text: The best shoes for me are the Keens with the big toe box. These shoes are a bit lighter than my previous pair of Austins which are quite heavy. Both pairs are very comfortable. Bad back, I take out the factory insoles and use the Dr. Scholl's $50 orthotics you get at the machine you stand on (Wal-Mart).
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite walking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought a pair of Keen hikers and loved them. I hoped these slip-ons would be as comfortable for everyday wear. They did not disappoint! Super comfortable, with great arch support and that generous Keen for bed. Love em!
customer_reviews.author: Clemdog

customer_reviews.title: Ain’t what they use to be...
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing Keens for years but I find the quality lacking in the last pair purchased (made in India) and even with the aide of a shoe horn it is difficult to put ones foot in the shoes. Once you get pass the painful part the shoe is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Oldthaiger

customer_reviews.title: Much Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my husband in the size he has used previously for Keen Austin (not slip on) shoes. He couldn’t even get his foot into the shoe, it was so tight. The shoe appears well made and is attractive, but our experience is that they aren’t true to size. I gave it 3 stars because of the quality of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy R

customer_reviews.title: Fit Problem
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit extremely tight around the ankle making them hard to get on. Also, the tongue dug into my ankle. Within a few minutes of wearing them, my ankle would have been worn raw. I love Keens, but I returned these. The company was great about the return. I ended up ordering a pair of Skechers instead.
customer_reviews.author: Dena

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: These shoes aren't wide enough. I had to send them back and they don't have wide width. I'm disappointed because I've heard good things about these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce B.

customer_reviews.title: Ankle collar bleeds paint, otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: Used to have a very similar model from Keen. This new version is a bit worse because the sole is a harder (feels more like plastic than rubber) and especially since the collar around the ankle bleeds paint so it will ruin white socks. Can only wear it with black socks.Also, interior is cloth, not leather (as in the older model). The mat (flat) black paint is very nice though, and the fit is great, like in the old model. Very comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeM

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe-
customer_reviews.text: These slip-ons are super comfortable and they just feel nice and stable. I have a narrow foot so I had to add an insert, but it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Glavin

customer_reviews.title: Not for me but good quality.
customer_reviews.text: bought for my son in size 14 but he didn’t like the toe box so we returned it. Amazon’s return policy let’s us busy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Toe box just a bit wide, but comfy and nice supportive arch. I tried this and the Brixen, which seemed to fit smaller and much tighter in width than these and also had just a little bit softer sole. I wound up going with the Brixen because of they are waterproof, had a softer sole and the color I wanted, but had to move a size up.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Old Keen better
customer_reviews.text: The old Keens are better. The quality is not that good, rubber soles coming apart in forefoot after only month having the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Manary

customer_reviews.title: Shoes  have a synthetic lining, that don’t ventilate well,
customer_reviews.text: The top of the shoe fits tight (tongue area) - will take a while to break in.. The previous model of the austin was much better. What I do like about this shoe is that it does not have the curved stitching on the top part - that always came apart after 10 months of wear...This is my 5th pair of the Austins..
customer_reviews.author: Z Swaringen

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. No need to break them in. Started wearing them 8-12hrs per day. Super comfortable. Only thing is that the rubber soles squeak a bit on vinyl floors.
customer_reviews.author: Lars H

customer_reviews.title: Keen brand is very consistent in sizing
customer_reviews.text: I stick to Keen, since they've never released a shoe that didn't fit me perfectly. #kudos
customer_reviews.author: Don Montalvo

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the comfort and look of this shoe. The price was right too!
customer_reviews.author: Joanie

customer_reviews.title: Nice, practical shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected after a break in period. Comfortable to walk in and feel well made. I expect they’ll last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Edmond J Fennell

customer_reviews.title: Love all my Keens
customer_reviews.text: Were pretty snug when I received them but there coming around really quick!
customer_reviews.author: M J M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: They are awesome as always. I think my feet have grown a bit over time. They used to fit like a glove, but now both the sportier Keens as well as this fits just a little snug.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro

customer_reviews.title: Not what was expected
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this shoe.. the quality has gone down hill. Top of shoe rode so high it cut into my ankle. Returned shoes
customer_reviews.author: C. Schnell

customer_reviews.title: Foot opening way too small.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10 without any problems - until these Keen slip-on shoes. The opening on both shoes is too small and tight to even get my foot into the shoe! I read this in other reviews before purchasing, and it is true. Do not buy this Keen style!
customer_reviews.author: epf

customer_reviews.title: Long time Keen wearer
customer_reviews.text: I wear these shoes daily. I have NO complaints with them.
customer_reviews.author: Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy duty. Try on first.
customer_reviews.text: Not up to quality of Keens I have. Less substantial uppers and soles.
customer_reviews.author: eleele

customer_reviews.title: shoe
customer_reviews.text: Well made shoe just did not fit like I needed it to
customer_reviews.author: hummer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Solid vendor.
customer_reviews.text: With Keen's I know the quality is always going to be consistently great. Solid arch support. Correctly sized. Tough and durable.
customer_reviews.author: DonH

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I really like the shoes but they were way too small. I own similar keen shoes in the same size that fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: David Huston

customer_reviews.title: Digs into front part of ankle.
customer_reviews.text: Everything fit fine; except for the piece we've the tongue would be. That part of the shoe digs into the front part of the ankle. I'm either going to cut down the middle about an inch or sew something to extend it so it doesn't dig straight into my ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, looks great. Hope to wear them for many years!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Keen slip ons
customer_reviews.text: Keen is definitely the way to go if you’re on your feet all day or use his work shoes
customer_reviews.author: Bret hendren

customer_reviews.title: Keen Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have had Keen shoes for a while and I love so when they wore out I ordered the same size I had and they fit perfectly !
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Rudinsky

customer_reviews.title: Great weekend shoes
customer_reviews.text: Slip them on and go. Good for all weather, good cushioning, durable.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: shoes are very stiff, after 2 weeks of wearing, slowly getting more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: cwh

customer_reviews.title: Standing shoes, not walking shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Work shoes for the office, very comfortable. Would not recommend for long walks as it fits loose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, comfortable and stylish. Like so much I bought a second pair in black.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Jones

customer_reviews.title: Quick service
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son-in-law. Keen is his favorite shoe brand and he was very pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah W

customer_reviews.title: Hard pass
customer_reviews.text: Crushed my feet and I don't even have big feet. Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: Aiden

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for everything.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for work and recreation. Even though they have a good footbed, it is removable for use with an insert of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Dave

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for credit
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit right Still have not seen my return credit on my credit card!!!! Amazon confirmed recieved my return weeks ago
customer_reviews.author: Joy little

customer_reviews.title: Good Casual Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoe. Lives up to the Keen name. Shoe runs a little small but loosened up when broke in.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Just love the Keen Austin shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I simply love these shoes. I put them on when I recieved them and have not taken tthem of and that was 7 hours ago. I know I have to wear the shoes for an entire day to be completely accurate in my appraisal, but these shoes are the great. If you can love a shoe, then I am in love. I bought the black and plan on buying the brown.
customer_reviews.author: Michele J. Walutes

product_meta.title: KEEN Austin Casual S - 1019508
product_meta.description: Always feel confident and sure-footed on any city street when you're wearing a pair of the KEEN® Austin Casual WP Slip-On shoes. Oiled nubuck and full grain leather upper. Features environmentally preferred premium leather from LGW-certified tanneries. Easy slip-on style with side gore panels for a secure yet flexible fit. Padded collar with suede trim for the ultimate luxe comfort. Interior is treated with Cleansport NXT™ technology for natural odor control. EVA strobel construction for added cushion and flexibility. Breathable mesh lining. Removable, metatomical EVA footbed with arch support provides excellent underfoot comfort. Compression-molded EVA midsole for added support and shock absorption. Non-marking rubber outsole. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 13 oz Product measurements were taken using size 11.5, width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
